item.title: Genevra add a quote by Tanith Lee
item.description: "How massively the mountains stand, while low to the ground the sand blows. The sand blows on and on. And then there are no mountains, none at all, the sand has kissed and whispered them away. And still, the sand blows on." -- Tanith Lee

item.title: Genevra add a quote by Tanith Lee
item.description: "Are not all loves secretly the same? A hundred flowers sprung from a single root." -- Tanith Lee

item.title: Genevra add a quote by Terry Pratchett
item.description: "Vimes felt his hand begin to move of its own accord-- And stopped. Red rage froze. There was The Beast, all around him. And that's all it was. A beast. Useful, but still a beast. You could hold it on a chain, and make it dance, and juggle balls. It didn't think. It was <I>dumb.</I> What you were, what <I>you</I> were, was not The Beast." -- Terry Pratchett

item.title: Genevra add a quote by Kage Baker
item.description: "Don't imagine she trembles over the dissecting table either, Smith. She has nerves of ice. <I>Real</I> Good can be as ruthless as Evil when it wants to accomplish something, let me tell you." -- Kage Baker

item.title: Genevra add a quote by Carla Speed McNeil
Genevra add a quote by Carla Speed McNeil
item.description: "The force of your gaze has a weight. Even sunlight resting on the ground weighs something. Your attention presses against its object, your eye projects it like a headlight. There's a flip side to it. Learn to go down inside yourself, dim the force of your presence. People's eyes will skate right over you. They'll see you; they just won't<I>notice</I> you. This works even if they're looking for you." -- Carla Speed McNeil

item.title: Genevra add a quote by Carla Speed McNeil
item.description: "They wept no animal's tears. They mourned in a great wickerwork of hard muscle and ragged breath. The hot smell of their coats, their black lips pulled back over ivory teeth, stiff sprays of white whiskers; their heavy hair plaited with silver and faience. Their thick hides shivered, as cattle will shiver away flies. <I>I</I> sweated and tried not to clear my throat." -- Carla Speed McNeil

item.title: Genevra add a quote by Carla Speed McNeil
Genevra add a quote by Carla Speed McNeil
Genevra add a quote by Carla Speed McNeil
item.description: "Excuse me. Nine hours ago, I broke off the single most pointlessly agonizing one-way relationship of my young life. It was a thin slice of hell, and now it is <I>over.</I>. He's not mine. He never <I>will</I> be mine, and I've thrown away three years of my life pining and hoping. Well, not anymore, and I need to get him out of my system. I've given the matter serious thought, and all I want right now is for some total stranger to nail me to a mattress for the next fourteen hours. I will almost certainly cry all over you and call you by his name, but I assure you that my sexual frustration has built to such a fever peak that I will fuck you <I>dry.</I> What do you say?" "<I>whine</I>" -- Carla Speed McNeil

item.title: Genevra add a quote by Lois McMaster Bujold
item.description: "I've always thought tests are a gift. And great tests are a great gift. To fail the test is a misfortune. But to refuse the test is to refuse the gift, and something worse, more irrevocable, than misfortune." -- Lois McMaster Bujold

item.title: Genevra add a quote by Lois McMaster Bujold
item.description: "Reputation is what other people know about you. Honor is what you know about yourself." -- Lois McMaster Bujold
